chemicals.name: Paracetamol
chemicals.about: Paracetamol is a common pain reliever and fever reducer.
chemicals.mechanism: Paracetamol works by inhibiting the synthesis of prostaglandins, which help to transmit pain and induce fever.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat mild to moderate pain and reduce fever.
chemicals.effects: Overdose can cause severe liver damage.

chemicals.name: Ibuprofen
chemicals.about: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain relief.
chemicals.mechanism: It reduces hormones that cause inflammation and pain in the body.
chemicals.uses: Used to reduce fever and treat pain or inflammation.
chemicals.effects: Can cause stomach ulcers and kidney issues with prolonged use.

chemicals.name: Aspirin
chemicals.about: Aspirin is a salicylate drug used to reduce pain, fever, or inflammation.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by inhibiting the enzyme cyclooxygenase, which produces prostaglandins.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat pain, reduce fever, and as a blood thinner.
chemicals.effects: May cause gastrointestinal bleeding and ulcers.

chemicals.name: Amoxicillin
chemicals.about: Amoxicillin is a penicillin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by inhibiting the synthesis of bacterial cell walls.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat infections like pneumonia, bronchitis, and infections of the ear, nose, throat, skin, or urinary tract.
chemicals.effects: May cause allergic reactions, including rash, itching, and anaphylaxis.

chemicals.name: Loratadine
chemicals.about: Loratadine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by blocking histamine, a substance in the body that causes allergic symptoms.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat allergies, hives, and other allergic reactions.
chemicals.effects: Can cause drowsiness, headache, and dry mouth.

chemicals.name: Metformin
chemicals.about: Metformin is an oral diabetes medicine that helps control blood sugar levels.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by decreasing glucose production in the liver and improving insulin sensitivity.
chemicals.uses: Used to improve blood sugar control in people with type 2 diabetes.
chemicals.effects: May cause gastrointestinal upset, including diarrhea, nausea, and vomiting.

chemicals.name: Ciprofloxacin
chemicals.about: Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by inhibiting bacterial DNA gyrase, thereby preventing replication of the bacteria.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat infections like urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, and skin infections.
chemicals.effects: May cause nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, and increased risk of tendonitis.

chemicals.name: Clopidogrel
chemicals.about: Clopidogrel is a blood thinner that prevents platelets in the blood from clumping together.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by inhibiting platelet aggregation, which helps prevent blood clots.
chemicals.uses: Used to prevent strokes, heart attacks, and other heart-related issues.
chemicals.effects: May cause bleeding, bruising, and, rarely, severe allergic reactions.

chemicals.name: Omeprazole
chemicals.about: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
chemicals.mechanism: It works by reducing the amount of acid your stomach makes.
chemicals.uses: Used to treat heartburn, stomach ulcers, and acid reflux.
chemicals.effects: May cause headache, stomach pain, and nausea.

chemicals.name: Atorvastatin
chemicals.about: Atorvastatin is a statin used to lower cholesterol and triglyceride levels.
chemicals.mechanism: It works by blocking an enzyme in the liver that produces cholesterol.
chemicals.uses: Used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart disease.
chemicals.effects: May cause muscle pain, liver damage, and increased blood sugar levels.
